comments.text: Sometimes I have to skip your videos because they make me hungry despite the fact that I have already eaten.  But I ALWAYS come back!

comments.text: Aww, this is my Portuguese grandma’s chicken soup, minus the cheese but with the cutting of potatoes directly into the pot! ❤
comments.author: @amandaychoi

comments.text: My grandma never had a beard but I love the soup 🍲 😮
comments.author: @Ronaldwort

comments.text: This is perfect for these cold weather days!
comments.author: @naume123

comments.text: I think what makes your cooking different is how intuitive it feels. You don’t seem to follow rigid steps, you just understand the core of it and simplify things naturally. I’ve been working a long time, and people who think like that often struggle in certain workplaces. Not because they’re not capable, but because they see through complexity quickly and focus on what actually matters. That kind of clarity isn’t always comfortable for others. It’s a strength though. Not everyone can think that way.
comments.author: @miahoooooooo

comments.text: Hello Italian Grandma 😁
comments.author: @aidansnene4850

comments.text: Love your soups and your style of cooking!! So many have simple ingredients but so much flavor!!

comments.text: Yummm
comments.author: @donnawatson845

comments.text: Giovanni, I have made some of your recipes and absolutely love them. I am Sicilian on both sides of the family. Your recipes are reminiscent of my Nona’s. All 4 of my grandparents were born in Sicily. My father came here to USA at age 14. I would love it if you were to publish a cookbook of all your glorious recipes.

comments.text: Among the many things I like about your videos- direct, short, clear, easy to understand, well-produced, warm, engaging- is that the ingredients and steps are right in the description. I really appreciate that. Thanks a lot.

comments.text: This looks delicious and I like the tip on keeping the pasta separate until ready to serve.  This way it can be served a few days after it is made.... if there is any left.
comments.author: @juliegraves6949

comments.text: No doubt its fantastic.  I make my soup like that except never did we cook the pasta in the broth, always separate.   Will try it, TY
comments.author: @lisacapo7600

comments.text:
What is that great cooking tool you use to brown and stir the chicken?! It looks so helpful. 
Hope your having a great week! God bless you and your family!
comments.author: @Jesuslovesusall-b1m

comments.text: I need those food 'tweezers'.... My grandparents used to put tons of carrots in- then blend some and thicken the soup..also put a whole tomato in. You've inspired me. I haven't made chicken soup since my spouse passed in April. Hard to have motivation. This was the push I needed.  Love your channel - you're so relaxed.

comments.text: Looks like mexican fideo but made the Italian way. So many cuisines have similar dishes  😊

comments.text: Omg!! My hungry stomach needs this thick delicious soup!! I hate brothy soups!! Love Love thick , hearty, stocky soups!!!😋😋😋
